datafield.subfield: The general relativistic Poynting-Robertson effect. II: A photon flux with nonzero angular momentum
The general relativistic Poynting-Robertson effect. II: A photon flux with nonzero angular momentum

We study the motion of a test particle in a stationary, axially and reflection symmetric spacetime of a central compact object, as affected by interaction with a test radiation field of the same symmetries. Considering the radiation flux with fixed but arbitrary (non-zero) angular momentum, we extend previous results limited to an equatorial motion within a zero-angular-momentum photon flux in the Kerr and Schwarzschild backgrounds. While a unique equilibrium circular orbit exists if the photon flux has zero angular momentum, multiple such orbits appear if the photon angular momentum is sufficiently high.

The unit velocity direction field $\hat\nu(k,n)$ of the radiation with respect to the ZAMOs is superimposed on the plot, showing the additional counterclockwise rotation of the photon trajectories with respect to the counterclockwise rotating ZAMOs. The dashed circles are the two null circular geodesics orbits. The gray filled circle extends to the horizon. The counterclockwise moving orbit settles down to the outermost critical orbit, while the clockwise moving orbit quickly falls into the innermost critical orbit near the horizon. The gray circle between the null orbits is the unstable critical orbit. This axes show units of $r/M$.
